channel.title: Comments on: Walkthrough: Setup Multiple IE Virtual Machines On A Mac

item.title: By: Mua Chung
item.dc:creator: Mua Chung
item.description: Hmm it seems like your blog ate my first comment (it was super long) so I guess I'll just sum it up what I submitted and say, I'm thoroughly enjoying your blog. I too am an aspiring blog blogger but I'm still new to everything. Do you have any points for first-time blog writers? I'd definitely appreciate it.
item.content:encoded: Hmm it seems like your blog ate my first comment (it was super long) so I guess I’ll just sum it up what I submitted and say, I’m thoroughly enjoying your blog. I too am an aspiring blog blogger but I’m still new to everything. Do you have any points for first-time blog writers? I’d definitely appreciate it.

item.title: By: Not giving money to Microsoft « High Altitude Hacking

item.description: [...] out the idea of using some images Microsoft makes available with different versions of IE on each (http://www.russellheimlich.com/blog/walkthrough-setup-multiple-ie-virtual-machines-on-a-mac/) HAH Results: If you read the last couple of comments on the referenced blog, you’ll see that [...]
item.content:encoded: […] out the idea of using some images Microsoft makes available with different versions of IE on each (http://www.russellheimlich.com.....-on-a-mac/) HAH Results: If you read the last couple of comments on the referenced blog, you’ll see that […]

item.title: By: revive
item.dc:creator: revive
item.description:
The Activation issue is one presented anytime the VPCs are converted to run in another Virtual Machine instead of M$'s ! Thanks M$ ! Anyways, there are one of two ways to make this work: 1) Find someone with the older, non-expiring, non-license-requiring VPC images for IE6, IE7 and IE8 2) Wait to see if M$ releases updated VPC images (since they expire Jan 01, 2010 it should be soon).. and hopefully they will fix this oversight..
If anyone has the aforementioned 'older, non-expiring, non-license-requiring VPC images' - PLEASE let me know ! :D
item.content:encoded:
The Activation issue is one presented anytime the VPCs are converted to run in another Virtual Machine instead of M$’s ! Thanks M$ ! Anyways, there are one of two ways to make this work:
1) Find someone with the older, non-expiring, non-license-requiring VPC images for IE6, IE7 and IE8
2) Wait to see if M$ releases updated VPC images (since they expire Jan 01, 2010 it should be soon).. and hopefully they will fix this oversight..

If anyone has the aforementioned ‘older, non-expiring, non-license-requiring VPC images’ – PLEASE let me know ! ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Justine
item.dc:creator: Justine
item.description:
Great walkthrough, thanks a lot.
However, I have the same problem as Joel - followed the steps by screwlewse and it's asking for activation and serial number. It was okay first time it started, but after restart (required after installing VMTools) it won't let me login at all.
item.content:encoded:
Great walkthrough, thanks a lot.

However, I have the same problem as Joel – followed the steps by screwlewse and it’s asking for activation and serial number. It was okay first time it started, but after restart (required after installing VMTools) it won’t let me login at all.

item.title: By: Joel
item.dc:creator: Joel
item.description: Yep - it's asking for a serial #

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Is it asking you for a serial number or something? If I remember to activate Windows you just click on a button and it does its thing over the Internet.
item.content:encoded: Is it asking you for a serial number or something? If I remember to activate Windows you just click on a button and it does its thing over the Internet.

item.title: By: Joel
item.dc:creator: Joel
item.description: Hmm, ok, so I followed the directions by screwlewse and when I run my VM - it's asking me to Activate my Windows version!? What the heck! What do I do now?
item.content:encoded: Hmm, ok, so I followed the directions by screwlewse and when I run my VM – it’s asking me to Activate my Windows version!? What the heck! What do I do now?

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: It should. Give it a whirl and let me know.
item.content:encoded: It should. Give it a whirl and let me know.

item.title: By: shawn
item.dc:creator: shawn
item.description: I'd like to run Windows 7 beta on my MBP w/ VMWare Fusion 2. Will this method fly with Windows 7?
item.content:encoded: I’d like to run Windows 7 beta on my MBP w/ VMWare Fusion 2. Will this method fly with Windows 7?
